nodes.text: Control Room. (pause) Main console in administrative state: compliance hold banner, draft memo queued. (pause) Blinking field wants a reason phrase more than the truth.
Logs are live. (pause) Printers got paper. (pause) Trays emptyIm noting it now. (pause) So it doesnt turn into a fight later.

Before you touch a verb—closure processing. (pause)
Don’t hand Finance a reclassification event. (pause)
Yeah, it sounds the same. (pause)
Finance won’t hear it that way.
Put the label on it first. (pause) Before you touch anything. (pause) Otherwise somebody names it after the fact, (pause) and it’ll be the worst possible name.

Standing pending. Service class pending. (pause)
Queue position maintained. Processing window active.

choices.text: use: Main console — submit reclassification request
ask: What category will you accept?
ask: What counts as authority chain?
leave: Step away from the console

nodes.text: You step back. The room keeps humming like it has a union contract.
Step out if you need to. (pause) Timestamp keeps running. (pause) Come back when youre ready. (pause) Do it on the record.
What category will you accept?

They’ll only take an existing service class. (pause)
They’re not clearing an unauthorized node state. (pause)
So if anything changes, it’s a reclass. (pause)
Into a licensed relationship—once eligibility’s demonstrated.
When they say “demonstrated,” (pause) they mean “asserted with attachments.” (pause) Nobody’s proving anything here. (pause) I’m saying that for the recording.

Licensed relationship’s fine—keep it in “municipal infrastructure.” (pause)
If it even smells like “research,” (pause)
we’re donating a fiscal year to committees.
Authority chain?

For the authority chain, they want operator-of-record ID. (pause)
They want you saying you’re at the endpoint. (pause)
Logged as a physical claim. (pause)
And they want counterparty acknowledgment—inside the licensed-relationship category.

Watch the verbs. (pause) “Acknowledgment.” “Acceptance.” (pause) Use those. (pause) Leave “authorization” alone. (pause) It drags baggage, and it still binds operationally. (pause) We’re not unpacking that right now.
Type it. Print before and after. Skip screenshots. (pause) They turn into opinions (pause) in a room full of lawyers.
The console opens AUTHORITY CHAIN: “Add signatory / add attachment / echo-back text.”
Console: “SUBMIT REQUEST — RELATIONSHIP/CLASS UPDATE (NON-LOCAL).” Fields: SUBJECT-NODE; REQUESTED-CATEGORY; REASON-PHRASE; AUTHORITY-CHAIN; ATTACHMENTS.
MTA. We’re submitting.

Keep the submission non-narrative. (pause)
Just: request category. Service class basis. Authority chain. (pause)
Don’t speculate on cause. (pause)
Turn it narrative, it’s jurisdiction.
And keep “authorize” out of it. (pause) That word starts a chain. (pause) It ends with duty—on paper. (pause) Then it lands on me.

Also—keep “discovery” out. (pause)
Even as a joke. (pause)
Someone will type it up as an admission.

choices.text: use: Select category — Licensed municipal infrastructure (legacy interconnection)
use: Select category — Temporary licensed interconnection (retirement processing)
ask: Read back the hold reference
leave: Cancel and step back

nodes.text: Read back the hold reference.

MTA_NOTICE_REF: [string]. (pause)
Submission log: [string]. (pause)
Queue position: maintained. (pause)
Processing window: active.
Print it from the tray. (pause) No photos, no retyping. (pause) Let the machine own the string.
The printer chatters. A header sheet slides into the tray.
You pick a category pretending past was competent enough to mean this. Legacy codes scroll, waiting.

Category request received: licensed relationship. (pause)
Service class requested: municipal infrastructure—legacy. (pause)
I need a reason phrase. (pause)
I need the authority chain. (pause)
No narrative.

If this lands, exposure closes and accounting stays. (pause)
That’s the only miracle we’re funded for.
In the authority chain, use “acknowledge.” (pause) “Accept” is fine too. (pause) Leave out “grant.” (pause) “Grant” reads like clean ownership. (pause) Nobody wants to sign that.
You choose the narrowest existing label. It feels like a lie engineered for survivability.

Good. “Temporary.” “Processing.” (pause)
Those words don’t buy us new obligations.
Also—don’t make it sound “ongoing.” (pause) Skip “keep it running.” (pause) Use “maintain continuity.”

Category’s acceptable once the reason phrase is in. (pause)
And the authority chain. (pause)
Send the reason phrase. (pause)
Send the attachments. (pause)
No narrative.

choices.text: give: Reason phrase — Retirement processing continuity; compliance hold resolution; continuous logging; operator present
give: Reason phrase — Reclassify SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL as legacy municipal infrastructure; acknowledge/accept licensed relationship
leave: Back out to category selection
give: Reason phrase — Retirement processing continuity; compliance hold resolution; continuous logging; operator present
give: Reason phrase — Reclassify SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL as legacy municipal infrastructure; acknowledge/accept licensed relationship
leave: Back out to category selection

nodes.text: Retirement-processing continuity; compliance-hold resolution; continuous-logging; operator present.

Reason phrase logged. (pause)
Still need the authority chain: operator-of-record ID (pause)
and counterparty acknowledgment (pause)
for licensed relationship classification.

That’s one sentence. Leave it as one. (pause)
Second sentence turns into a story.
Reclassify SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL: legacy municipal infrastructure; accept licensed relationship.
Strip anything that smells like novelty. (pause) “Legacy” is fine—it reads like old paperwork. (pause) And cut “still.”

“Legacy municipal infrastructure” is fine in the ledger. (pause)
Just don’t put it in the headline.

Reason phrase logged. (pause)
Legacy municipal infrastructure framing noted. (pause)
Still need the authority chain. (pause)
Operator-of-record ID. (pause)
Counterparty acknowledgment.

choices.text: give: Add OLEA Legal as co-signer (recorded acknowledgment)
give: Submit with operator-only authority chain
persuade: Mark as municipal legacy asset under OLEA retirement authority
leave: Back out

nodes.text: Operator-of-record: on-site. Submitting under retirement processing.
I’m not telling you you can’t. (pause) I’m telling you how it reads: you’re alone. (pause) In the record. (pause) Alone isn’t illegal. (pause) It’s just expensive.

Authority chain’s incomplete. (pause)
For 'licensed' classification, they want a counterparty ack.
Mark it as municipal legacy asset. (pause) Under OLEA retirement authority. (pause) Operator-of-record present. (pause) Continuous logging. (pause) No narrative.

Requested framing recorded. (pause)
Municipal legacy service class can proceed. (pause)
It’s under a licensed relationship, (pause)
with a valid authority chain. (pause)
Still need counterparty acknowledgment.
They’ll go along with the outcome. (pause) They just won’t be first in the chain. (pause) Get them an acknowledgment (pause) they can actually file.
You tap OLEA Legal’s recorded line into the chain. The console prepares an echo-back for acknowledgment.

On-screen echo-back: “OLEA Legal acknowledges-submission for category-update/retirement-processing-instrument; accepts limited-purpose-licensed-relationship classification for SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL; no-admission-of-novelty; continuous-logging-maintained; operator-present on-site.”

Alright—on the record: OLEA Legal acknowledges the submission. (pause) Category update filed as retirement instrument. (pause) Limited purpose only. (pause) Accepts licensed relationship classification for SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL. (pause) Under municipal legacy infrastructure service class. (pause) No admission of novelty. (pause) Continuous logging maintained. (pause) Operator present on-site.
When that echo-back screen posts, (pause) print it. (pause) Otherwise youll get accused (pause) of paraphrasing the legal part.

Acknowledgment received. (pause)
Send attachments and operator-of-record ID.

choices.text: show: Attach memo draft and hold reference printout
show: Attach full retirement packet (binder scan)
ask: Confirm service class eligibility
leave: Cancel

nodes.text: Memo and notice reference attached.

Attachments received. (pause)
Indicator’s a conditional pass—pending operator-of-record identification.

Title it “retirement processing.” (pause)
Keep “renegotiation” out—words get searched.
Full retirement packet attached.

Attachments received. (pause)
Standing indicator: conditional pass—pending operator-of-record ID.
Confirm service class eligibility.

Eligibility checks out: municipal legacy infrastructure service class. (pause)
Acceptable under a limited-purpose licensed relationship classification. (pause)
With a valid authority chain. (pause)
And an endpoint presence statement. (pause)
Queue position maintained. (pause)
Processing window active.

choices.text: give: Operator-of-record identification and on-site statement
leave: Back

nodes.text: Operator-of-record: Field Systems Specialist. On-site.

Operator presence statement logged as a physical claim. (pause)
Submission complete. (pause)
Processing.
The console displays: “PROCESSING WINDOW ACTIVE.” The printer starts again, like it wants witnesses.

Standing: satisfied for limited-purpose licensed relationship. (pause)
Service class: municipal legacy infrastructure. (pause)
Action: SOL‑EARTH‑LOCAL reclassified into licensed relationship. (pause)
Interconnection operational under new category.

Staple it to the front of the packet. (pause)
Shows the system signed off. (pause)
At least on paper.
